channel.title: Noob question on TOR
channel.description:
I always have associated Tor with Http/Https requests and responses. Is there a way to take advantage of Tor for none web based activity? For example If I want to use a tool such as nmap or some other socket tool, can you still use Tor?
I am looking at ways to improve my anonymity. I hear that using both Tor and VPN is one way of doing so. But I want to be able to perform other activities than web based interrogations?
Reading the Tor site just references the use of the Tor Browser.
Thanks
bin

item.title: Noob question on TOR
item.dc:creator: system
item.description:
This topic was automatically closed after 30 days. New replies are no longer allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Noob question on TOR
item.dc:creator: EternalEclipse
item.description:
pry0cc:

So it lets you tunnel all kinds of traffic (except ICMP), over tor.

Tor does not support UDP, only TCP (and indirecty, DNS).

Read full topic

item.description:
cool pry0cc, thanks I have an article on my desktop on chaining proxies in kali. Next article I was going to read.

Read full topic

item.title: Noob question on TOR
item.dc:creator: pry0cc
item.description:
Tor is a socks proxy.

So it lets you tunnel all kinds of traffic (except ICMP), over tor.

You can nmap, metasploit, gobuster, or any number of things by using proxychains.

A brief introduction to ProxyChains Networking
Hello everyone of 0x00! I figured why not make my first contribution, so heres a quick one Today, im going to brush the topic of proxies, followed by how to set up ProxyChains to make being tracked a bit harder. So first things first. What is a proxy? In computer networks, a proxy server is a server (a computer system or an application) that acts as an intermediary for requests from clients seeking resources from other servers. –Proxy Server - Wikipedia What a proxy does, is essent…

Read full topic
